intro: Cirrhopetalum autumnale, commonly known as the autumn bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, blooming in the fall. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are borne on long, slender pedicels, and the plant is known for its delicate, fragrant blossoms. Cirrhopetalum autumnale is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky slopes.
